subject: p18110020
History: A-year-old female with developmental delay and NG tube for feeds.
Findings: There continues to be markedly severe S-shaped scoliosis of the thoracolumbar spine. The endogastric tube courses inferiorly into the stomach with its sideport well below the GE junction however, the NG tube does appear kinked in the segment that is just 45-5 cm upstream from the sideport. The right PICC tip is in the lower SVC. Within the limits of a severely scoliotic patient, the cardiac and mediastinal contours appear normal. The lungs demonstrate mild retrocardiac atelectasis. There is no large pleural effusion or pneumothorax.
Impression: NG tube kinked within the stomach -consider minimal retraction to reposition. Severe scoliosis with mild retrocardiac atelectasis.
